meanings.definition: Not able to be relied on or trusted.
meanings.sent1: Her old car was so unreliable that it broke down every week.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast turned out to be unreliable, as it started raining unexpectedly.
meanings.sent3: The unreliable toaster decided to burn the toast just when she was running late.
meanings.sent4: His promises were as unreliable as a broken compass in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The unreliable Wi-Fi made it impossible to join the online meeting.

meanings.sent1: The unreliable witness gave conflicting statements during the trial.
meanings.sent2: Buying a used phone online can be risky due to unreliable sellers.
meanings.sent3: The unreliable alarm clock decided to go off an hour early, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was as unreliable as a leaky bucket, forgetting important details.
meanings.sent5: The unreliable bus schedule made her late for work multiple times.
